column4: guys, how can i have a music player start playing an mp3 file at X:YZ PM?
Using terminal is fine with me.
(I'm going to use it as an alarm clock)
gnome-open file.mp3 | at x.yz
use 24 hour notation
that's it? looks pretty easy, even for a ubu-baby like me
what's difficult (sometimes) is to find out how to do things like that.
yeah.
it also works for a playlist, yes?
i tried your command, but the program opens up and starts immediately
I see -- I thought it would work with gnome-open, but it doesn't. Use a command line mp3 player like mpg321
i tried totem, and totem works/plays the music, but it does so now, and not later
mplayer -loop
mplayer foo.mp3 | at 15:22 makes the music start now. and not later. are you sure you have the right command/syntax?
the syntax is right, but it works with some programs, but not others.
the syntax you gave me is the reverse of what jrib gives me
I've just tested jrib's and mine -- with mplayer jrib's is best.
how do i do your syntax?
with a different player program. Try mpg321
atq to view, atrm number to remove
thanks. you r good
it's probably time to read some mplayer documentation. Check out 'man mplayer' and the stuff in /usr/share/doc/mplayer/
